Do Something: Mindfulness & Mental Health for Software Engineers - Patrick Martin - ACCU Short Talks
---

In this ACCU 2025 lightning talk, "Do Something," the speaker offers a humorous, heartfelt, and insightful reflection on mental health for software engineers. Addressing the importance of action and self-awareness, the talk blends engineering humor with powerful messages about mindfulness for engineers, burnout prevention for programmers, and the value of experiential awareness.

Through the lens of a fictional “Brian damage” diagnosis and a lighthearted exploration of rehabilitation, the speaker highlights how simple sensory practices — like forest bathing (shinrin yoku), breathing exercises, and mindful attention — can improve brain health and mental resilience. These ideas resonate strongly with anyone navigating the stress and cognitive load of software development.
